text: need to share your screen or get remote
access during an Amazon chai meeting
this video shows you how anyone in an
Amazon chime meeting can share their
screen you don't have to be the
organizer just make sure you have the
Amazon chime desktop app installed on
your desktop choose screen then share
screen to share your whole screen or
share window to share a specific area of
your screen those attending the meeting
through the Amazon chime app on their
phone receive an alert to ignore or view
your screen on a desktop the shared
screen simply pops up on the mobile app
toggle between screen viewing and the
attendee list you can still use mute
access video and switch to speakerphone
rotate the device to use a larger
portion of your screen and use the pinch
to zoom gesture to get a closer look
if you're in a meeting with someone who
doesn't have an Amazon chime account
they can still view a shared screen in a
browser with the Amazon chime web app
start by having them open the meeting
link this opens a new browser tab they
can enter their name that will be shown
in the roster then click Next
Amazon chime asks them to select their
audio option and then they will be added
to the meeting the Amazon Web app offers
many features during the meeting
including a meeting roster meeting chat
and meeting controls when someone in the
meeting shares their screen it is
displayed while on a call
sometimes viewing a shared screen isn't
enough and attendees need to be more
hands-on if you're on a call on your
Windows or Mac desktop app and you're
sharing your entire screen attendees
using their desktop Amazon chime app can
request to take control of your desktop
this is helpful while doing a
demonstration troubleshooting an issue
or promoting collaboration they choose
share then request shared control you
get a prompt to deny or allow the shared
controlled request after the person has
been allowed control they take over the
keyboard and mouse controls on your
laptop to complete tasks you see their
name associated with their Mouse more
than one user can take advantage of this
feature at the same time so multiple
people can work on one device that's how
you view a shared screen and use remote
access on Amazon chime now go get your
collaboration on
